meanings.sent1: Some people can be real jackasses when they refuse to listen to others.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a jackass and make sure to think before you speak.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a group of jackasses who always got into silly situations.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness made him act like a complete jackass during the argument.
meanings.sent5: The movie character was portrayed as a lovable jackass who always made people laugh.

meanings.sent1: The farm had a few jackasses that helped with carrying heavy loads.
meanings.sent2: The jackass brayed loudly in the barn early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids decided to ride the jackasses around the farm for fun.
meanings.sent4: The stubborn jackass refused to move from its spot no matter how much they tried.
meanings.sent5: The old farmer had a special bond with his loyal jackass who had been with him for years.
